result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander R. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any assessments/treatment ordered by the agent and follow through with all recommendations.  

Costs have been remitted by the Court.

Defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation and should follow up with the Clerk of Court when the time comes for that procedure.

Credit in the event of revocation:  3 days.


Concurrent with: 15CM156 and 16CM46

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to jail on or before Monday, June 27, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

Huber privileges granted.

RCSD Dispo of warrant or commitment for time served.
Court, having reviewed Defendant's letter of June 9, 2016, states it is "moot"

Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court, in custody of the sheriff, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 16CM53, 16CM46, and 15CM156 called together for sentencing after revocation, together with status in 16CM58. Counsel state the agent's recommendation, which they also request in the revoked cases. 

Court follows the request and orders: 

16CM53, 9 months jail, with 80 days credit.
16CM46, 9 months jail, concurrent with 16CM53 (same 80 days to be indicated on JOC).
15CM156, 90 days jail, concurrent with 16CM53 and 16CM46 (same 80 days to be indicated on JOC).
Fees in all cases ordered as civil judgment.

Defense requests 4-day stay of these sentences.  Defendant to report on or before Monday, June 27, between 6-7 a.m.  Huber granted.

16CM58 - counsel indicate there may be new information; ask for further status.
from def requesting bail hearing on revocation matters.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Letter from def requesting bail hearing on revocation matters; Judge Sharp's response

Several cases called together:  16CM46 and 16CM53/initial appearance, 16CM36/adjourned initial, 15CM156/status, 16TR288/status.  Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby 16TR288 will be dismissed and 16CM36 will be dismissed/read in; def will plead to count 1 in 15CM156, count 1 in 16CM53, and count 1 in 16CM46; remaining counts in those cases to be dismissed/read in.

Def pleads to counts 1 in each 15CM156, 16CM53, and 16CM46.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  Withheld for 2 years probation.  Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any assessments/treatment ordered by the agent and follow through with all recommendations.  Pay costs - 1 set imposed; the rest remitted.  Defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.

Credit in the event of revocation:  2 days in 15CM156, 3 days in 16CM53, and 1 day in 16CM46.

All other counts in the criminal cases dismissed/read-in.  16TR228 also dismissed.
Completed as part of the plea/sentencing hearing in this and other matters this date.  Minutes taken to the plea/sentencing event.
